Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Eva L
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We stayed last year for 9 days and had a really good time. It is right in the centre of Rome with Metro and bus and supermarket 5 minutes walk away.The hotel was very nice, small but neat and clean and distinguished interior. But most of all: The hotel staff was really friendly and helpful - going out of their way to make your stay a happy one. Be it from advice on where to find what in and out of town,interesting places to visit, to helping finding our luggage which the airline had lost. - If you want a small almost family run but distinguished place - this is the one. --- I would go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel . Excellent Staff. great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jkiddscot
Reviews.Content: Montecarlo Hotel - only a few blocks away from the piazza cinquecento and Termini but like all sides of the Termini - you quickly enter normal Rome after a few streets. The Hotel is situated across the road from the Best Western and has a couple of very good local Ristorantes to either side street from the Via Palestro. The concierge are professional and courteous and friendly the ground floor is marble floored and new cedar wood fittings to the entrances. the rooms are large and bathrooms well tiled. aircon is excellent. the breakfast is continental and they serve excellent rolls and croissants. the coffee is fantastic (though you might to order caffe con latte or they wont bring you milk!) its a good location to be the Metro stop Castro Petrorio is just a street away and you get to most places very quickly via metro for 1 euro (for a 75 minute ticket)).

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Ki1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Montecarlo in March 2011 at a 3bed room that we found in offer at a great price. The room was big an comfortable an de the bathroom was very clean. Stuff was very friendly and very willing to help in everything we asked especially Franco and the ladies at the breakfast room. Breakfast was great with great variety and amount though the breakfast room needs to be renewed. On the negatives is definately the elevator.. The location is quiet, with the metro station and a bus stop about 10-15 minutes away. In general all three of us were very satisfied about staying there and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: pennlkh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in February. On arrival, we were very well greeted by Franco and another colleague. Our bags were taken to our room straight away. They also warned me about the hotel lift and that my baby's pushchair will not fit into the lift... And it very nearly did not. It is the tiniest lift ever.. The chair and me fitted but only just. The room was clean but small especially for a triple room. Bathroom was ok. There is a fridge so I could buy milk for my daughter. On the first night I asked for milk at the hotel as the supermarkets were already shut and they charged me €3 for a small jug. Not complaining as glad I managed to get milk but was glad to find a supermarket the next day as 1 litre bottle of milk cost only around €1.50. No kettle though. We edit not try the breakfast as heard it was all cold food and I don't like cold breakfast. Also I got a password for the wifi which is fast and I had connection in the room perfectly fine even though we were on the 5th floor. If you need a cot for babies, they charge a shocking €15 per night. Location is pretty good. From termini station, it takes around 10mins walk though there is a metro station about 5mins away from the hotel. Rome is a fantastic city and is best seen on foot. Metro tickets cost €1 per trip or €4 for the day. I would definitely go back to Rome and possibly to hotel montecarlo if the price is right next time.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dinos_from_Greece
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, near Termini (train) station. We traveled Rome at 22/12/10 and stayed there for 5 nights. The hotel was very clean. I want to say "thanks" to all from reception desk, especialy Michael. They are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good. The rooms are big enough and clean. If you want a very nice and clean hotel, with helpful front desk, near center, with low price, then Montecarlo is your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Winter Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anna H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and quiet. Rooms are a bit dark but it is a part of general interior design so it actually looks even interesting and creates the "old mansion" atmosphere. First thing that surprised me was the size of the elevator. People suffering from claustropfobia - deffinitely ask for a room on lower floors so that you wouldn't need to use the elevator!!! It's aprox 70cm wide and 1m deep. So the first time we used it i was really feeling uncomfortable, but later after walking for 10 hours i felt quite okay riding that "glass coffin" to the 5th floor so you'll get used to it. Personnel is really nice and polite. TV has no English channels so be sure to have a laptop with you if you wish to wach a movie in the evening. WiFi is free, just ask administrator for a password, connection is also very good and stable. In January in the evening it get's rather cold even in Italy but it's no problem as air conditioning keeps the air in the room as warm as you like. Breakfast is very light, no warm dishes but it is totally sufficient for a day start and the coffee is really good (same as pastries). If you need to open a bottle of wine go downstairs to the bar( in case if bartender is away just ask administrator to help). The only thing that i could complain about is the low level of soundproofing - i could hear what is happening in the corridor and they could hear what was happening in our room. But it is Italy, so feel free to be noisy and be ready to hear people talking emotionally and all the time :) In case of night check-out they offer a transfer to Fiumicino for 55euros, but you can also use the night Cotral bus.

Reviews.Title: “Nana x 2”
Reviews.Author: Sandra L
Reviews.Content: We (two females) booked this hotel through my Travel Agent and all reports seemed to be good. It was for one night before joining a tour. We arrived at Monte Carlo after travelling straight through from Australia via Dubai so extremely tired to be met at the steps and told we had to go elsewhere as there was no room for us. We were told our new hotel would be very nice and just a short distance away and he gave us a voucher to hand in at the next hotel. The porter pulled our luggage quite a long way away and we found our new hotel was a disaster. There were two "hotels" to a floor in this building and very old and gloomy and seemed to be more of a backpackers. We tend to think because we were a one night stay they had a better offer. They can weep because I am going again this year and will be staying in Rome twice but not at Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with great reception desk.”
Reviews.Author: Chele123
Reviews.Content: Front desk was amazing... Franco, Michael and all the other guys. Breakfast lady was really nice making me a delicious Coffee in the morning. Walking distance to transportation, sites and great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Green T
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. But very gloomy rooms. You can not spend few hours of a day there if it is raining or so. Bath is too small. Pie shaped area with radius 1.5 feet may be, with sliding door. You can not even move your hands or turn around. Staff is very good and friendly. It is 5 min walk from nearest station and 2/3 good restaurants near.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: Karin V
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that the front desk staff at the Hotel Montecarlo are very friendly & helpful. I was always greeted with a smile. However, the room was disappointing. I had some difficulty finding a room in Rome at one week's notice & this one had the best reviews. My main issue is the smell of sewerage that came from the drain in the bathroom. I was on the 5th floor & was still forced to plug or put cardboard over the drain holes to limit the smell. I even had to close the bathroom door. The single bed was also very narrow so be warned if you're not accustomed to sleeping on a narrow single bed. The room was as clean as you could get an older room with carpet & the sheets were also clean. I had stayed one night earlier at a 2 star hotel & found it to be more spacious & comfortable. Access to the main sights was very easy & it's close to both the main train station & a smaller train station.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place but perhaps a bit offside”
Reviews.Author: PGonTour
Reviews.Content: We arrived a bit before check-in at 14.00 so we had to sit in the bar area. Seems like it's in need of an update of the furnitures and walls. It was probably renovated some 10 years ago and all a bit worn down. Around 14.15 we got our room and it was very nice. Good size, clean, refrigerator, AC, LCD-tv, an ok bathroom, but with a small shower. The traffic is very low at night and you don't need an open window because of the AC. Breakfast was alright with different choices, unfortunately not so many choices of plain bread (1 type really). As with the bar area, the breakfast room is in need of an update. Warning! Look out for dirty plates and knifes! This was a problem every morning we were there. The service in the breakfast room was fast and efficient. The staff was generally helpful although not so fluent in English in some cases. The location is a bit beside the attractions but the metro is nearby and so are the buses. The Wifi... They told us it costed 15 EUR per day(!). I find that very disappointing when on holiday! It seems they haven't updated their website in all languages and there is no mentioning of this fee (September 2011) I can certainly stay at this hotel again, if they just skip the Wifi fee!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: joievivre
Reviews.Content: When I booked I initially had a problem with my credit card after giving them the correct one they didn't respond to my emails asking if everything was ok. The night before we were to arrive I had to call and I was told that he had been too busy to respond to my email. I was worried at what kind of stay we would have. But after checking in the fellow at reception was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was also good. Location was great, quite close to Termini which for us worked out as we did a day trip to Pompei too. Our problems came when we asked for an iron, unfortunately they didn't feel that was a necessity for a hotel to provide. The other thing is that the sheets don't get changed every day, we had to ask after noticing a couple of days that there was a stain. In addition another day we didn't get clean towels, we had come back from a long day in the sun so I wanted to shower before going to bed, I called asking for towels and the response was you want towels now? They did come up but despite them being busy I was surprised at his response. I gave it a three instead of a two only because two or three of the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: mary1ireland
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the door we got the smell of pee. We had a problem with our booking - they denied receiving a phone call.As time went on we could understand what had happened. There are so many different guys on reception they obviously do not pass on the relevant information to each other and do not update their computer. On the first day we made our payment and got a receipt. When checking out they had no recollection of payment. We were lucky to have kept the receipt carefully.The carpet in our room was filthy.I am sorry I did nt take a photo of it. Big black dirt tracks. The bed linen was clean and the beds comfortable. Our toilet did nt flush but when we reported this to reception they got it sorted quickly. The bathroom was fine. Breakfast was very basic. Tinned fruit, cereal, bread, cheese, salami- that was about it. At night the lift did nt work. We were on the fifth floor and after walking all day we were in no mood for climbing 5 flights of stairs.We found this hotel too far away from sights. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay Sept 2011, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: TMaxDublin
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, reasonably well located smallish hotel within easy walk of Termini & Castro Pretorio metro stations. We received a very warm welcome from Franco (has worked there 15 years which says a lot about the atmosphere there). Breakfast, although still a basic 'continental' better than most we've had anywhere in Italy, incl much bigger/dearer hotels... again friendly staff and nice fresh coffee served to tables. Hotel has a small bar off reception, which nobody uses but it provided a pleasent sit down area for a short while. The TV room is mainly a (very useful) luggage storage room & has (pay) internet service there.... our room had (pay) wireless. Bedrooms we saw were reasonably sized, our had a fridge & TV, very clean, towels change good but decor 'dark'. No hotel restaurant, other than breakfast room. Reasonably priced restaurants on same street, recommend Taverna Pretoriana & make sure you get a discount card at hotel before going. We used it 3 times.Although hotel convenient to Termini, it's a little away from the more 'downbeat' side streets of Termini. Except for determined walkers, the location of the hotel means a bus or metro trip to downtown Rome & most of the sights, buts thats okay as metro cheap/nearby & quick. Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Seira77
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, and the staff was awesome. Very helpful and nice, rare for Italians! The room was elegant and beautiful. We got an amazing deal by reserving last minute!!! Saved about $45 per night! So nedleless to say it was a great value for the money. There is a dry-clean shop on the same street a couple blocks down that has laundry service for cheap. Found this tone a great plus!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd time in Rome, and the staff made us feel as if we part of the family”
Reviews.Author: jerphil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a neighborhood that must beone of the safest in Rome, The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The rooms are average size for a European hotel, very clean and the open gage lift and the marble floors gave us a feeling that we were staying in the history of Rome. The Montecarlo is a 3 star hotel with a 5 star atmosphere. The Breakfast was traditional with great friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarile
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this small hotel. The room and the bathroom were very clean. The location is good, 40 minutes walk to the main attractions. Close to the train station. Breakfast was excellent! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We took a room for 4, a bit small but normal size to most of Rome hotels I stayed before.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vagab0nd08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our last night out of Italy. We wanted something close to the Termini and with accessible places to sight see and eat. This hotel has a great location; and is in a nice quiet part of town. Very friendly, helpful and courteous reception and staff including Roberto. Easy access from the Termini and from Piazza Republica. Free Wi fi and includes breakfast although we left very early in the am, so did not eat it. But they gave us coffee/cappucino at 6 am before we left. We also ate at a great restaurant nearby called Ristorante Capitale, a really nice family-run pizzeria and ristorante. Their soup was fabulous and just what the doctor orderd for our tired bodies! So were all their pizzas and side dishes. Also a great gellato place round the corner from the hotel. Perfect way to end our stay in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich_karen_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Montecarlo Hotel and found it a pleasant place to stay. It actually had the feel of a good hotel unlike some others we stayed at on this vacation. The room was small but clean and neatly appointed. The air conditioning worked well and that was great since it is hot in Rome in June. The bathroom had a good shower and hot water with good water pressure. The breakfast was very good with tasty pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit and delicious coffee. The breakfast room was downstairs and was pleasant. The staff was helpful calling our tour number for us to confirm our tours. All in all I think it was a good hotel for the price and I would stay there again. The only short coming is that it is pretty far away from the main tourist attractions although close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet street”
Reviews.Author: sombochris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good area with a lot of embassies nearby. It is handy to the main train station. The staff speak good English. The marble floor is spotless. The hotel is well maintained, but 1920's style. The bar was very cosy at christmas. The room was a reasonable size for italian standards. The cost was very reasonable. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Camp padded cell”
Reviews.Author: joancollins69
Reviews.Content: The location was 10 minute walk from main station (airport arrival & train) also a metro stop even closer, but due to repairs it would be easier from termi. All staff encountered were lovely even handsome with great English & helpful navigating Romes buses. Rooms padded in material but didn't lend itself to noise proof but that was more neighbors in the halls playing up. Breakfast ample but all cold choices with no toast you won't starve. Only gripe was my bathroom was small & if elderly maybe difficult to move in and wifi worked downstairs only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel plesantly furnished & decorated”
Reviews.Author: sambo_1986
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome in April 2010 and stayed at the Montecarlo Hotel. The hotel is situated near to the main train station in the centre of Rome, about a 5-10 mintue walk. This is also the nearest place you can get on to the Rome metro (both lines A & B) which can take you all around the city and is fairly cheap for a day pass. The hotel has a Wi-Fi connection that you had to pay for and was fairly expensive (€10 24hrs) and wasn't the most reliable connection! It did a job though and was ok for casual use. The hotel has a very nice feature lift. The room was clean and the decor was in a traditional Italian style! The room had a mini bar and TV which only had a couple of English speaking channels namely BBC world news. Overall our stay at the hotel was plesant and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for families would certainly return”
Reviews.Author: janiceivy
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms for 6 adults and 3 children. Two of the rooms (the corner rooms) were very spacious and above expectations--Jacuzzi tub, flat screen tv with satelite. The 3rd room was nice, especailly for a European hotel room. The rate was very reasonable--I dealt directly with the management and they gave us a price break since we had 3 rooms for 4 nights. It is located in a nice neighborhood, and is convenient to the train station. The breakfast room was a typical European cold breakfast, but was sufficient. The hotel was very clean, nicely furnished and very friendly staff. Our family would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Gallascpa
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel at a very reasonable price. Not too far from the main Terminal station which was a plus. Continental breakfast was ok, nothing fabulous. Rooms were decent size and the bathrooms were nicer than other European hotels that I've stayed at before. My biggest gripe was no free WIFI. Traveling with a group of high school students who couldn't communicate with their parents was a bummer. Could have purchased it for 15€ per day, but it wasn't in our budget. Overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but may improve.”
Reviews.Author: fgayer
Reviews.Content: At the arrived we had a bad susprise. We were overbooked! There was no room, then they put us in a hotel nearby. Altough it was a good hotel (also a three star), the displacement was very inconvenient! On the next day we moved back again and the stay was good. Clean rooms, gentle staff. The breakfast could be better, but it was good. The location is good, but not so close to the metro lines because Rome has few lines. Considering how expensive are hotels in Rome, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: LizyKate
Reviews.Content: We arrived hot and tired, they did not have the room for three we reserved through expedia. Luckily I had my receipt so they finally gave us a second room for my daughter. Noy good but I did not want to try to find a different place that night. They showed us the breakfast location. The rooms were run down, air conditioning does not work well, breakfast not very good,separate charge for wifi that we thought was included but it was not listed on the receipt. After we had eaten breakfast the second day they decided to charge E40 for breakfast! Staff not friendly. Located next door to XXXX cinema. Not a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “good base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: streetatbriden
Reviews.Content: The best thing was the helpful , friendly & efficient staff especially concierge Franco. Good location near the Termini station, walking distance of Colosseum, some ok restaurants nearby. Breakfast was good plenty of choice, quick service

Reviews.Title: “Montecarlo is a winner”
Reviews.Author: ukwlb
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this area of Rome before I wanted to stay here this time because it is really convenient for the Termini Station and the bus connections to the Airport. Found this hotel online and liked a lot of the comments I'd read on Trip Advisor. Our room was small on the 5th Floor. With its very high ceiling, it was probably bigger from floor to ceiling than it was from side to side. The bathroom was small too and the shower cubicle wouldn't be any good for a claustrophobic but it was all scrupulously clean and very comfortable. No complaints at all. We just needed somewhere to sleep, shower and breakfast as we explored this beautiful city. The bed was a very comfortable double, even if it was a "zip and link". We slept like logs. The linen was spotless. The TV was an old portable type but we weren't in the room to watch telly. Saw a bit of a football match one evening, that's about it. There was a fridge in the room too if you wanted to stock up on water or beer. Overall, the room was extremely quiet and peaceful. Breakfast was of the continental variety and plenty of it. We had breakfast three mornings and weren't bored by the varieties on offer. Lots of fresh meats and cheeses, pastries, cakes, bread rolls, fruit and fruit juice, coffee and many varieties of tea. Filled up on breakfast, we didn't eat until the evenings, it was enough to keep us going as we trekked around Rome. We'd read comments about the antiquated lift, but we had no problems with it, Only once did someone leave the outer door open on another floor so we couldn't use it. It was quiet too, not clanking away all night like some hotels I've stayed in. Would I choose this hotel again? Yes I would. It was in a nice area, easy to reach, friendly staff and so clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colley76
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay in this hotel. The hotel is clean, comforable and well furnished. The antique lift is worth a mention in its own right. Breakfast was good. Staff are friendly & helpful. The hotel is 15 min walk from Termini station, so it is quite handy for the Metro. The hotel itself is in a fairly quiet area. There are several restaurants in the area, but, like the rest of Rome they tend to be expensive. Try the Ethiopean restaurant, just around the corner. Reasonable prices, and a change from Italian food. If you are over 65, always carry your passport. It will get you into many attractions FREE, that is a big advantage in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel with friendly personable service”
Reviews.Author: Ernest60
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant and friendly hotel which I would not hesitate in recommending. Just 10 mins walk from the main train/bus "Termini" station. The only slight negative was some disturbance from converations in the street in the early hours (room on 1st floor, window slighly open). But maybe I'm just not used enough to Rome ....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for sightseeing and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jancart
Reviews.Content: Good location and being just outsiode the City centre (10 Mins to station) restaurants were cheaper and used by locals as well as tourists. The hotel was clean, staff were friendly, although english was a little difficult at times. Breakfast was good and service excellent. Our room was clean, quite large with jacuzzi shower. Although we were on the main street it was quiet and an excellent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Very Helpful Staff, But Problems”
Reviews.Author: Cubanjimbo
Reviews.Content: The best thing that stands out about this hotel is the location (very close to the Termini station) and other metro stops. The staff was very friendly and helpful most of the time. Our room's air conditioner did not work. When we called the desk to report it, we were only told to "open the window". The noise from the street was loud at times. Just glad it was not a hot time in Rome! The old-style elevator in the center was broken more often than it worked.

Reviews.Title: “still worth it”
Reviews.Author: HongKongPainter
Reviews.Content: it's my 3rd time stay in this hotel. great location, reasonable price and unbeatable concierge service. all concierges (franco, claudio and michael) are kind and efficient, esp franco, who's always smiling and most helpful, makes you feel like home. all of them speak eng too. however, they're not superman and cannot serve everyone at the same time both at reception and at bar. the hotel is quite short of staff during rush hour, and it's always rush hours now since most of the time it's fully booked. the breakfast still hasn't improved since my first stay in 2009, sometimes the bread are not v. fresh during weekend (hard to chew when it's cold, and there's no toaster), still no fresh fruit, and the cereal is far from appealing. the cakes/pies are mostly untouched, so i don't know why they don't try to provide more variety of fresh bread instead (eg. plain croissant instead of sweeten ones). loud radio in the breakfast room featuring outdated pop music everyday, which really makes your head ache (thank god it's jazz music at the bar at night). most of the time we cannot find eng newspaper in the hotel. room is mostly clean except the floor, which is often dusty (check the back of your luggage after u put it down flat on the floor), makes one wonder whether they ever vacuum. maid service kind of sloppy, always forget to refill toilet paper. all in all, i'll come back again because of the warm hospitality of the concierge, which makes a difference from other 3 star hotels in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: LynnBattram
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good value hotel that was within walking distance of the Termini and bus station which this was. With wheeled luggage it took about 10 mins to walk from the Termini. We had a standard triple room and it was very nice with full sized beds and a nice shower room. The very old elaborate lift was a delight to look at and use. The staff were friendly, the continental breakfast was nice and fresh and capaccino coffee very good. We arrived early and left our luggage until 2pm when the room was ready so we could make use of our first day in Rome. Overall, a very clean, well located hotel and excellent value for a central hotel in Rome. I don't remember the front of the hotel looking like the photo on this sight though, it was quite small and understated.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tsiki
Reviews.Content: Pro- location, very nice rooms Con- staff is not really helpful (don't really know anything about stuff in Rome, though they are nice)

Reviews.Title: “Just adequate”
Reviews.Author: LSCats
Reviews.Content: While the Montecarlo suited our needs and everything about it was adequate, I would not give it the glowing reviews posted by others. The hotel decor is dated and the rooms are dark. The elevator often would not work during our stay, usually because someone left its gate open on any of the floors, which caused it not to work. The stair hike from any of the upper floors to the lobby or breakfast room was difficult (especially for my arthritic knees). I was initially pleased that our room had a bathtub with shower rather than the tiny shower stall in other rooms. However, the tub had no glass screen or curtain and it was just about impossible to take a shower without the entire bathroom getting soaked. The towels were thin and skimpy. The breakfast selections were only OK. As breakfast is included in the price of the room, the limited continental breakfast (juice, coffee & tea, canned fruit -- no fresh, cold cereal, cheese & ham) was understandable but not as good as comparable hotels we stayed at during our trip. The staff was not good at giving directions (They did but we usually found better routes). The restaurants they recommended were the ones they got a kick-back for and definitely not the best around. Nevertheless there were literally hundreds of restaurants and cafes within walking distance so good choices were plentiful. The location was OK and as others have said, you could walk to the train station (where there are also hop-on-off buses. Because we had luggage, the hotel advised us to get there initially by cab so we did, not knowing that the charge for the 6 block ride was going to be 37 EURO! We walked back to the station when we left, rolling our luggage. Even then, when I asked for the best walking route, the desk attendant directed us down the narrowest street with uneven sidewalks, which was partially blocked by a street market. We cut off onto a much wider street with smooth sidewalks. So if you stay at the Montecarlo, either walk or take one of the hotel shuttle buses or a city bus from and to the train station. I have noticed that the guests who are happiest with this hotel are from the UK and Australia so perhaps they expect less of hotels. But even for a 3 star hotel, I saw room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: virag0229
Reviews.Content: It's 5 minutes from Termini station, we found it very easily. It was clean and comfortable, not a 5 star but perfectly OK for our long weekend stay. I recommend it to everyone! We loved the little caffee opposite the hotel (little further up), it is very cheap and very italian!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...felt let down when check-in, otherwise fine accomodation”
Reviews.Author: YSie
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms ( 1 superior, 1 standard room ) for 1 week. Standard room was in fact a single bed room with extra bed added, room was super tiny, could even open the door fully !!, When i complained at the reception, they promised better room next day ( what if i did not complain ???? ) That room was really sub-par, i couldn't understand that you can give that kind of room to your customer. Next day they gave us a better room, my son ( 17yrs) said, "yes..i can now turn around in the room without hitting anything ;) ). Location was ideal, spanish steps was around 20 min walking, very close to Termini station, a lot of decently priced restaurant nearby. Piazza Republica about 15 min walking. Most of the staffs are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is good though not much variations. Rooms are well furnished and clean. Aircon works super !. Except the "not so decent" treatment they did to us with the cramped room without prior notice, we actually enjoyed our stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Close in location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn051
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It was close to bus and metro. Rooms are clean, comfortable and breakfast was enjoyable. The reception staff were always pleasant and helpful. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel in decent neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Merrymeade
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and we were mostly impressed by the hotel especially given its reasonable room rates. Yes the rooms are small. Yes having a shower was like getting wet in an upright coffin and the breakfast was non-variable and bland. The single lift was old, slow and out of order on occasion, so we had to walk up and down 8 flights of stairs half-a-dozen times. However the rooms we had were clean, the towels were clean, the rooms were air-conditioned and equipped with a flat screen T.V and frigobar. Most of the reception staff were friendly and helpful, for example one member of staff found and printed out train times to Florence for us. The hotel is in a safe and quiet location, only a 10 minute walk from the B-line metro station, Castro Pretorio. This means you are only 1 Euro and three stops from The Colosseum for example. The hotel is actually located on the same street as the Turkish Embassy, so there is a constant presence of armed Italian soldiers a block down from the hotel which was more reassuring than worrying. There are a few dozen restaurants within a 10 minute walk of the hotel, all full of locals as well as tourists so there is no need to eat at the riff-off tourist restaurants around the main sights of Rome. There is a mini-market called Sigma, a 5 minute walk from the hotel to stock up on water and cheap wine. There is also a porno cinema right around the corner from the hotel, but there was never any dodgy people hanging around outside it so that wasn`t a problem. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Rome cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: xxcatwomanxx
Reviews.Content: We got a standard room with a double bed (which is actually two single beds put together) during our stay in Rome. The location is convenient only because it is close to Roma Termini. Otherwise expect to walk quite a bit (or take the subway) if you want to see the Trevi Fountain, Coloseum, Forum, etc. There really isn't much around and the neighborhood looks a little sketch at night. You have to walk at least 15-20min before you start seeing more cafés, restaurants or bars. The room we got was tiny and it was overall quite clean, however one of our "clean" towels had disgusting yellow brownish stains on it. It is not the worst hotel we have stayed at in Italy but I wouldn't recommend it. I saw a lot of nicer hotels near the Trevi Fountains and the Coloseum.

Reviews.Title: “no way”
Reviews.Author: kingzransom
Reviews.Content: We booked and confirmed 4 rooms two months ago. We got there early and they held our luggage. So far so good. Rooms were to be ready at 2 PM. Only three were ready, and in one the air conditioning was broken - it was near 90F. That family was forced to wait until after 6 PM when they moved them to the hotel next door. The fourth room was still not ready at 6PM and to get ready to go out they had to share a room (making 5 people in a small room). Not until we returned at 11 PM did they have a room. And the worst part was that the manager and person behind the desk did not care. I would NEVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel not too far from the train station”
Reviews.Author: ta_dave
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good enough, but not fantastic. This was to be the first hotel my wife and I were to stay on our trip to Europe. We took the train from the airport to the train station in Rome then walked to the hotel from there. It was raining, but it wasn't supposed to be too far from the station. When we got to the hotel, the staff informed us that our room had problems with the water. I wasn't sure if this meant problems with the rain or plumbing. They told us they will put us in a different hotel for the night just "five minutes away". In fact, it was much less than five minutes. The staff were very apologetic and served us drinks from the bar while we relaxed a bit. After staying one night down the street in another hotel, we returned to Montecarlo. I thought the staff in general were friendly, but the hotel was just very basic. Very small rooms, very small bathrooms, and very thin walls (it was quite easy to hear the amorous couple next door). I read people complain about the adult movie theater next door. This was no problem at all. Not once did I see anyone walk in or loiter around the theater. In fact, I wonder how that theater along with the strip club across the street could stay open, as I'd seen no one go into either. They probably get lots of business from all the embassies in the area during the day. The hotel is literally surrounded by embassies. Overall, it wasn't too bad of a hotel. I'd stay there again if I had to, but I'd probably try testing out another hotel in the area for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not So Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: lebvg90210
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were told that there was a problem with the water on our floor so they would have to move us to the hotel next door for one night. They promised to give us the nicest rooms in the hotel when we returned the next night. The other hotel was decent, but in the morning when we were showering the power went out and didn't come back on in the area. When we got to the Montecarlo for the next night, we were given two tiny rooms, not the "nicest" rooms that we were expecting. When we explained this to the person at the front desk, he acted like we were silly to even ask about this because all the rooms were the same size and if we wanted a bigger room we should have stayed at a four star hotel. Then we tried to get a discounted price or free internet for our inconveniences, but we were told that since we booked on hotels.com we were not privileged enough to get free internet. This did NOT demonstrate good customer service. Besides being small, the rooms were nice and clean with fluffy towels. One big problem, however, was that the air conditioning would turn off in the night and we would wake up sweating, only to not be able to turn it back on right away. We had to stand by the wall in the middle of the night and keep pressing the power button until it decided to finally start up again. This did not allow for a good nights' sleep. When we called the front desk about this, the same rude staffer from the other day told us that there was simply nothing he could do. He did not even offer to come and help us with it or make any apologies. Overall: Good location, Nice hotel, Poor Staff

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: blueskies96
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Montecarlo and found that it was perfect for our family's 3 day visit to Rome. I had searched extensively on Trip Advisor but was having a difficult time finding one room to accommodate 4 people for a reasonable price. This hotel met those criteria but references to the Termini station area being somewhat seedy had me a bit nervous. When our family arrived at the station after taking the train from the FCO airport, we did find the immediate area around the station to be a bit questionable in regards to safety (we arrived after dark), but as soon as we started walking towards the hotel we found the area to be much nicer. We also found the Termini station area to be fine during the day. We were happy to find several good dining options within a few blocks of the hotel and felt very safe for our entire visit. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous and they had no problems communicating with us in English. We comfortably fit into one room, with single beds for each of the kids (ages 6 and 9). The room itself was clean and the bathroom was modern with plenty of hot water, water pressure, etc. Our kids loved the old elevator and are still talking about it. The breakfast was average but adequate for getting us off to a good start each day. While other parts of Rome may be more popular, I do not think we would have been happier anywhere else - and we would have paid much more. We did buy tickets for one of the hop-on/hop-off bus services and found it to be well worth the money. We highly recommend it for anyone who wants to see a lot of Rome and get around stress-free. The bus rides gave us (especially the kids) opportunities to rest, thus giving us the energy to see that much more when we did walk around to see the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in the Termini area”
Reviews.Author: Puddinator
Reviews.Content: Great choice and good value for the Termini area in Rome - close enough to be convenient but well outside the zone of seediness. Rooms were actually beautiful - alot of time went into planning the decor and furniture. I like the separate banana beds that can be pushed together to form a double. The bathrooms were spotless. The breakfast featured fresh meat, cheese, yogurt, juices, cereals and coffee to order. The staff was helpful. Since people who stay in the Termini area are usually passing through Rome, they should go ahead and provide wifi access in the lobby instead of forcing you to pay 1E to use their antiquated machine for 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Dropbox
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 days in the Montecarlo, Rome. It won't win any awards but if you want a clean, reasonably priced hotel in a good location you could do a lot worse. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Termini (the central station) and/or Castro Pretorio metro stations. It's on a fairly quiet road, with a few nice trattorias and restaurants spotted nearby. Being just north-west of a major station the area is a bit rough-and-ready, with more than its fair share of local "wildlife", but we never felt unsafe or threatened. Also, for those who care about such things, there's an adult cinema and strip club round the corner. Again, you won't notice them except the frontage (no pun intended). Busses run from Termini to everywhere you want to go, and the metro "A" and "B" lines cross there so it's the perfect starting point for your journeys around the city. The rooms have decent bathrooms, beds and aircon. Staff are on the whole friendly and helpful and the prices were great for the location. It also still boasts an original, if updated, wrought-iron lift column in the centre of the building, although all the other features are nice and modern. We didn't eat at the hotel (why would you? You're in Rome!) so I can't tell you anything about the food. My main positive about this place is location for the price, which is pretty darn good. My main negative would be that the beds are very hard. This is a general Italian thing, and the hotel provide blankets which we used under the sheets to soften the beds.. Finally a couple of tips if you stay here: First: There's a great cafe down the road (Ristocampo, V. Montebello 59) open weekdays for your quick pre-touristic coffee. 70 cents for a caffe, or 1 euro for a latte? Can't go wrong... Second: There's a laundrette (Tintoria "Guisy", V. Montebello 44) which will wash, dry and fold 5 kilos (11 lbs) of laundry for 8 Euros. Great if you like to travel light light, as we do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: retiredandtraveling
Reviews.Content: Our family of 8 stayed for 3 nights. Each room varied in size (from small to large), and were very clean. Rooms overlooking the street were a little noisy, but our room in the back was very quiet. Bathroom included shampoos, lotions, shower cap, etc. as well as LARGE bath towels. Plenty of hot water and water pressure at anytime. Maid service daily. The 3 different men at the front desk were all very helpful, spoke English easily and tended to all our requests. Lobby was pleasant with a bar and sitting areas. Breakfast was very typical of small hotels in Europe: sweet rolls, breads, cold cereals, ham, cheese, fruit. We were quickly served coffee. Even though the hotel was fully booked, we had no problem finding a table in the breakfast room. Although the location is a little far out from the city center, we walked to and from in about 30 minutes. The metro is a 3-4 minute walk, easy to navigate. The Termini train station is about 10 minutes away. We did not walk with our luggage to or from - the sidewalks would be somewhat difficult to pull a large suitcase over, but doable. The restaurants we ate at were within a 2-3 block radius of the hotel. All were great, especially the Preatoriana Trattoria - the front desk gave us a discount coupon and we went twice - the food was excellent and the service was great. I would definitely recomment the MonteCarlo for a pleasant, small ,Roman hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, and Family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Moonlightbyme
Reviews.Content: Great location that my family and I felt safe. All of the staff were nice. Mr. Franco at the counter is a very kind person. He helped us a lot for our trip. Olga and Janina gave us warm welcome at the breakfast room. The food were exellent. The room was clean. Everyone who goes to Rome should stay in this hotel. You will feel like you have a lovely family in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location ,friendly staff ,small room”
Reviews.Author: OMIDREZA
Reviews.Content: you can walk from train station to hotel in 15 minutes.good for solo travelers Because you are in hotel only 5 or 6 hours .there is a very small shower in room and also thre is a free WIFI internet in room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Good Value...For Rome”
Reviews.Author: Limey1
Reviews.Content: In a city famous for its expensive hotels, the Hotel Montecarlo provides good value for money. Do not be put off by its exterior. It's nothing special at all from the outside but the lobby and rooms are of a good standard. Its best asset is its location. Located in the embassy district, only a five minute walk from a metro station which is only three stops from the colosseum. My wife and I always felt safe walking back late at night - possibly due to the number of police guarding the embassies. Our room was comfortable and clean if not luxurious. The shower was only ever lukewarm at best but that's our only grumble. Definately worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Value, convenience and tranquility all in one of the busiest cities in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: Phil2252
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Rome and Hotel Montecarlo was my best choice to date. It was great value, extremely clean, the staff is friendly and efficient. The one negative was the width of our beds. I shared a twin room with a friend and we both had the same sensation that our single beds were narrower than normal. We slept very well and did not fall out of bed! We ate locally 4 nights out of the 6 and found a good range of restaurants within a 10 minutes walk of the hotel. There is an excellent pizzeria on Via Piave.We also found a good wine bar, I think it was called Triman it is between the hotel and the train station, near Via XX Septembre .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Hondo1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept of 2009. Don't expect American standards here, room in Italy are much different then in the US. The hotel lobby and coffee bar area were beautiful and the staff was great even the ones that did not speak much English tried their best to be helpful. The rooms are a decent size. We had a room with two twin beds, we pushed them together each night and then when housekeeping came to clean the room they would separate them again. I don't mind firm beds but these beds were very firm, but after a day of walking they felt ok. Bathroom was a ok size, shower was small and the toilet was very close to the wall. But it was decent enough for out stay that we did not notice it to much. There was a small tv in the room and it was kinda of fun to watch old reruns of eight is enough and the A-Team in Italian. We payed extra to have breakfast at the hotel. It was good, pastries, cereals, fruits and a lady that would make coffees for you. The hotel is a good distance from many of the major landmarks but it was still walkable. It was also near the train station where you could catch a train or subway or a cab if you did not feel like walking. There are several good restaurants near the hotel and they all had great food. Only bad thing about the hotel was that the a/c was very weak about all it did was keep the humidity down so we would have to keep our window open a bit to keep the room cooled. Overall it was a nice hotel and if ever make it back to Rome we might thing about staying here again if we couldn't find a place closer to major landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: andra_m_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from Rome, and we stayed on this hotel. We had a triple room, was exactly like in their photos (blue one). The room was decently big, also the bathroom was ok, maybe the shower was a bit too small. As location, is very close of Castro Pretorio Metro, and also close of Termini, but we used more Castro Pretorio. Near the hotel, at 50m or so, is a bus stop, where bus 492 goes in center. Also there are a lot of buses passing through, so make sure you check them, we discovered them in our third day only :P. Breakfast was good, not so many variery but was ok. It doesn't have a restaurant, but they recomend a restaurant near the hotel - we never tried it though. Room was clean, staff was helpful, we had free internet acces (wireless) which was great because helped us to better plan from one day to another (i planned the trip from home, but the plan and the reality didn't match exactly), so that was another plus. The beds was very good, we had sleep very well, and the area is pretty quiet and safe, there are a lot of embassys around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nm007dubai
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is about 5-6 blocks away from the termini station and is near to the start point for various tours and hop in hop off bus stops. Room was clean and the breakfast was adequate. very friendly staff, helped us to plan our itenerary and provided information whenever required. one disappointment was expensive internet and should have been free for atleast an hour for the number of days stayed.To sum it all it was good value for money but little add on's could be great.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for "adequate" look no further...”
Reviews.Author: rkotlow
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I enjoy traveling on a budget and did not want to settle for any hotel that was less than 3-star. I found a great deal (for Rome prices) on this hotel at one of the major travel consolidator websites. The hotel has a fantastic location--6 blocks walking distance from Rome Tremini Station. The neighborhood was secure, and there were various "snack bars" in the area for getting a sandwich or pastry. We also found that the hotel was within easy walking / subway distance to many of the famous attractions in Rome. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. There is a liquor bar at the hotel, and breakfast is available too. The building is historic, but a neophite at 120 years old, compared to the other structures of Rome. The rooms are decorated in traditional Italian style with deep blue cloth wall covering and heavy drapery. We were pleased to have a flat screen TV with cable, mini-bar, wardrobe, and marble bathroom. The carpeting and mattress was in need of replacement. The room was clean and fresh. There is also ONE computer with free internet for guest use. There is no printer, so don't plan to print any tickets or reservations at the hotel. Overall, we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Silentstalion
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a great location, 10 min walk from tremini train station located in a very clean part of town. Upon check in the staff was nice and friendly, they took us to our room and made sure we were happy. The rooms are very very clean and roomy for italian standards. The bathrooms were nice and big, they had steam showers in them which adds for a nice showers. The street is clean and it makes getting around the city quick. Book with confidence we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff- Away from tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: MiniLinnie13
Reviews.Content: The pleasant suprise about this hotel was the staff- very friendly and helpful. They gave very good recommendations to places! The location is away from tourist areas which is really nice and around all the embassy's. We could walk to the train station and Piazza de Repubblicca which has an English speaking movie theatre too! The breakfast was reasonable- just enough to get by before lunch but nothing special. The room is comfortable and Italy-sized. The bathroom is a good size, had heated towel racks, a shower-style jacuzzi with jets, and has all the neccessities. The rooms also have an LCD TV which is nice. Overall, if you're not in your room a lot and don't mind walking 5 minutes to transportation it's a great value. We would stay here again if on a budget in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: tsingman
Reviews.Content: Nice, pleasant 3-star hotel in the embassy area about 10 minutes' walk from the main railway station. Rooms and showers a bit small; the superior room is better. Internet access in the room if you ask them, but unfortunately no tea service. Staff are generally friendly. Their best and most efficient staff is Franco at the reception desk. Always courteous, patient and helpful, he knows Rome inside out and can give directions and make all sorts of recommendations. He's multilingual too, and had no problems communicating with us in English. The hotel is lucky to have him. He'll definitely make guests want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cappahayden
Reviews.Content: This was a comfortable, convenient and cosy hotel...very friendly and helpful staff. Nice room, great location. We will definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location, O.K. breakfast, very small room”
Reviews.Author: Megelainew
Reviews.Content: Stayed in quad room with husband and two teenagers. The room was too small to accommodate 4 people comfortably. No place to put the luggage. Barely enough room to move around beds. Front desk staff was kind and helpful. Breakfast room staff was not. Common areas were attractive and price of mini bar items very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lmc920
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our four night stay in Rome and were very pleased. The front desk staff couldn't have been nicer, and were happy to offer assistance as we needed it. Our room was comfortable and always clean. The hotel was in a great location away from the noise of the city, but close enough to get everywhere. Great choice for us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: tonywojo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel exceeded our expectations, the rooms are small, but very clean and well kept. The breakfast is good. The out of the way service is what I will remember most. A group of 8 of us, and we had to leave early for a tour, before breakfast was served. They had Cappucino's for all of us as well as fresh croissants. They were always ready to assist with any needs at any time of day. THe location was also very convenient, close to the Termini, the Metro, walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montecarlo in July. Within easy walking distance of the Termini station. Lots of restaurants nearby. Walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain no problem. Bus stop a short distance away as well as the metro stop. All in all great location easy to get to major sites. Adequate breakfast, though could get tiring if staying for more than a few days. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious, AC worked great! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: chewiegranolabar
Reviews.Content: The location of Montecarlo is not central and we had a hard time finding the hotel. Reception was not exceptionally helpful or warm. We preferred to take the bus around instead of train as the hotel seemed far from the train station. However, the nearest bus stop was still a ten minute walk away. The bus route was quite good, bringing us to Colosseum and Trevi Fountain areas, where we could walk to the other attractions. The room was very spacious and looked just like the website. It was quite old fashioned, but it was a decent stay. Prices were not cheap (like all Rome hotels) and did not come with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Frank029
Reviews.Content: See review by zam72 of Oulu Finland, he/she describe this hotel very well. We also stayed at the Milani hotel which was also within walking distance. We found the A/C adequate, could have been better. Wifi or internet was $1 euro for 20 minutes but was fast. The TV's were small but had some english stations. The elevator was cool, like something from the 1920's. The service was excellent, especially from Franco.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: zam72
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Hotel Montecarlo when we visited Rome in July 2009. The Hotel Montecarlo is well situated close to Roma Termini railway station (ca 10 min walk). However, the metro station Castro Pretorio (line B) is closer to the hotel than the Termini station. There are plenty of hotels in the area and also many embassies are located near the hotel (incl. e.g. Turkey and United Kingdom), so there were soldiers guarding on the nearby streets 24 hours a day. There is an adult cinema theatre around the corner from the hotel but it did not cause any nuisance to passers-by. The hotel seemed to be rather recently renovated as the bathrooms were pretty new and the rooms were clean. The staff in the reception and at breakfast was very helpful. We had booked a double and a single room in the "classic" (i.e. cheaper) category. They proved to be very good and filled all our needs. Views from both rooms were normal street views. Beds were good and rooms of decent size, not very big though. The rooms have wall-to-wall carpets which made the air a bit stuffy. The double room was similar to those advertised on hotel's website. The single room was with similar decor but naturally smaller. In the single room the bathroom was rather cramped and the shower cubicle very small and the slat door of the cubicle was very difficult to close causing water from the shower watering half of the bathroom before you managed to get the door closed. Air-conditioning in the rooms was efficient but rather noisy. The air-conditioning could be regulated from the room, but adjusting it did not affect the noise it made (unless you switched it off completely). The rooms were equipped with a safe and minibar where the prices were the same as in the hotel's lounge bar. The hotel building seems to be an old residential building. There are still private residences in the 3rd and 6th floor as well as in the parts behind the actual hotel. Owners of these private residences use the same staircase as hotel residents although they have their own entrance from the side street. The biggest drawback in the hotel is its poor breakfast. It is a continental type buffet breakfast with very very limited selection. There is absolutely nothing fresh on the table and no meat cutlets or sausages, either. The breakfast consists of bread rolls, butter and processed cheese, jams, sweet pastries and sweet pies, cereals, and tinned fruits and tinned fruitsalad and a selection of juices. Coffee and tea are served to the tables. The breakfast room is a rather small place (two small rooms). Notice! This hotel is not suitable for the disabled due to the number of stairs. There are half a dozen steps from the street to the reception, then a couple of steps to the bar lounge from which again half a dozen steps down to the lift. Also the breakfast room is located in the basement to which lead only a narrow staircase. Despite the breakfast I could stay in the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS!”
Reviews.Author: JeffJaneRoma
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with everything. Room was clean. Breakfast was included, and the brioche and cappuccino were delicious! The staff was exceptionally honest, courteous, professional, and friendly. I had checked out and discovered on return to the States that I had left a fairly expensive gift of jewelry in the room. Without much hope of recovery, I called and was told that the staff had located it and that arrangements would be made to mail it back to me. Needless to say I was very impressed and very relieved. Viva Hotel Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “average price for an average hotel, but clean and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: smile2142
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just recently returned from our 4 night stay at the Montecarlo Hotel. The hotel was easy to find and conveniently situated for the central train and bus station (Termini). Approximately 10-15mins walk. Also close by is the tour company ‘Enjoy Rome‘ who can also help with tourist information. The check in for this hotel went smoothly and the staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. It was clean, air conditioned, our room came with a combination locking safe, chilled mini bar and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom had all modern facilities including bath/shower, bidet and large sink. All were very clean. Unfortunately we did not receive the room as shown in the pictures advertised. The room we did get was similarly decorated but on the small side, almost cramped. Although perfectly sized for one person. Our biggest grumble with our room was the lighting. Where the ceiling light should have been was a smoke detector (a good thing), the only illumination came from two dull wall lights, both situated on the same side of the room. If you like your gadgets or simply wish to charge your phone/camera, there were only two sockets, one for the TV and one for the fridge. The only spare was located in the bathroom for the shaver or toothbrush. The view from our window was a building so close you could almost touch it. Breakfast was a cosy affair, but very limited in choice of food. A small range of a continental breakfast, with cereal. If the room was booked with no breakfast included you were charged 10 Euros per person per day. Not really worth it in our opinion, due to shops in town offering a wider selection for a cheaper price. We did not use any of the other amenities offered by the hotel. We just used it for a bed between lots of sightseeing. I would recommend this hotel to people only staying a couple of nights. Which are going to be out all day, so just using it for somewhere to rest their heads. It maybe an idea to ask to see the room before accepting it if you want something a little more spacious. The best things were the staff being friendly and the cleanliness of the hotel. The worst things were the size and the dim lighting in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Montecarlo, Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: akak8
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at hotel Montecarlo. The day and evening concierge were always kind and courteous- and extremely helpful with finding landmarks, directions. etc. I am hoping to go back to Italy, and I would most likely stay at Hotel Montecarlo. (Unless they are booked!) Its location is quiet, which personally I like, yet it is within walking distance of the metro. If you take a taxi, I might suggest - if you have difficulty with the price, the concierge came out to talk to the taxi driver (noting we seemed to have a concern) We really appreciated that. I've done a bit of traveling, and sure enough always encounter one person looking for a naive tourist, to make an extra dollar. UGH! [that is one thing I'm not] Not this traveler.... all the more reason to appreciate people like I met at Hotelmontecarlo!!! Pictured is one very pleasant, and helpful evening concierge! Speaking to him was such a pleasure- so intelligent, well read and informative. very refreshing!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo twice- before and after our cruise. The first visit was for 2 nights and the second was only one night. Both rooms were so very quiet and peaceful and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was quite good. The air conditioning worked amazingly well- it was so hot in Rome that we really appreciated the a.c.! The staff was very helpful and friendly. Upon arriving in Rome, we took the train to Termini station and then walked to the hotel with our luggage. We didn't have that much luggage, and it was a bit far for me. If you have a lot of luggage, my advice is to let the hotel staff arrange for a car or mini van to pick you up at the airport. When we returned to Termini at the end of our vacation, we tried to get a cab at the station, but the cab drivers wouldn't take us, so we ended up walking again. I think it was too short of a haul for them. The staff at the Montecarlo arranged a minivan back to the airport for us on our last day. It cost 60 euros total and it was well worth it not to have to walk to the train station with our luggage at 6:30 am and then take a crowded train. We ate at several restaurants around the Montecarlo and all were very good. Just walk down the street and pick any restaurant, you won't be disappointed. All in all, our stays at the Montecarlo were quite enjoyable, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that close to Termini with luggage”
Reviews.Author: bobolee55
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night before our cruise, because we were taking train to Civitavechia from Termini. The hotel room is small, which is standard in europe, but the shower is really small, its hard to put soap on, i dropped it twice, had to get out of shower to pick it up, and i weigh 112 pounds, dont know how bigger man even put on soap in there. I read in TA front desk Franco is super nice, but I only saw him for 2 minutes in the evening, the other times were different guys, one is not that nice. We were in a rush to catch the train after Sistine chapel visit, he not only didnt help us carry the heavy luggage down the steps to the street, but told us in not a nice way that we owe him for breakfast (they charge $30 for breakfast for 2, thats a rip off), we didnt even eat there. We had 2 croissants and expresso around the corner for 3 euro, they were delicious. Both my husband and I told him we didnt eat there, he didnt believe it, still checking and checking, we couldnt wait any longer and just left, we were in a rush to catch the train to the port. The hotel is not as close as we thought to Termini, thats the whole reason we stayed there. If you dont have luggage, maybe 7-8 minutes walk, but we have big luggage for the cruise, its at least 15 mintues walk, and not easy to drag on some cobble stone streets. I would find some other place closer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: Randa11
Reviews.Content: I would say by far this was the best service we received at this hotel in our whole trip to Europe. When we walked in the door and while we were checking in the first thing the host did was pull out a map and mark exactly where we were at on the map. He then circled all the hotspot that we needed to see along with the closest bus & metro stop and even gave us the bus numbers. Upon arriving late, 9pm, we were upgraded to a balcony room which was wonderful. Room was large enough and ensuite bathroom was nice, both were very clean. There was a lift that was plenty spacious but we were only on the 1st floor so always chose to take the stairs as was faster then waiting on the lift. Breakfast was included in the price and plentiful, consisted of breads, cheese, fruit, cold cereals, several juices to choose from and hot drinks to order. Hotel also had a bar for drinks, computer was supplied but it cost for the internet at 1 eruo for 10 minutes. Only complaint was that the 1st floor where our room was it had a heavy smell of smoke from cigaretts, as I belive there was a staff room on that floor. Even though the smell was strong in the hallway are non-smoking room never smelt. We did have a street side room with large window that opened to the balcony but when window was shut was very quite, didn't hear much noice at all. Another service the hotel provided for us, at cost, was a car service to and from the hotel. A little pricy but we thought was worth the money since we arrived in the city at 8pm and left at 4am, we never had to worry about how to get to and from. Hotel is a little off the beatin path but only about 5-6 blocks from busy tourist section. We used the Ciao Roma tourist buses, the hotel sells tickets you can purchase them from them & then they call and arrange for you at a pickup. You pay a partial fee to the hotel and they give you a ticket then you present ticket to driver and pay the remained to him. The bus service took us to all the major tourist spots that you would want to go to, they are general pickup/dropoff spots so you do have to do alot of walking. Finding the bus stops took a little bit but you just have to look for the blue bus stop signs as there are several different type of tourist buses and you have to make sure you get on the right one or your ticket is no good. Hotel host was always very willing to give us directions or recommendations upon our asking. Would definately recommend this hotel and book again upon a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: scubamargie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Montecarlo Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, and even though we had a room facing the street it was so quiet. The area is safe and not too far from Termini train station. It is a bit of a walk to the downtown attractions, but if you take the train it's not bad. I appreciated the in-room wireless internet. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, decent price, reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: richardwkirk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a reasonable location. It is away from the main sites however fairly easy to access using public transport or a bearable walk. It took us 20min at a fairly quick pace to get back from the Trevi fountain. Allow 30mins to stoll it! Buses stopped very close to the hotel so made access very easy. Our room was in the new section of the hotel. This meant that it was spotlessly clean with new everything. Unfortunately since we were there in January it was pretty cold. When we arrived the windows were open and the heating off. Once we worked out the air conditioning it was ok though. Unfortunately we never got the heated towel rail working so the bathroom was a bit cold. Breakfast was ok. There wasn't a huge amount of choice but what was available was good. Get there early for the best pastries and to ensure a seat in the smallish breakfast room. Overall the hotel was a good place to stay for a short break. The staff were very friendly and the facilities more than adequate. The only problems were the slightly greater distance from the centre and a cold room at first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at friendly Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: Noeffe
Reviews.Content: What we really enjoyed: - Mr Franco Spaccialbelli at the reception desk! What a great guy, totally service-minded. - The beautifully decorated room. Very cosy. - The proximity to Termini station. - The excellent restaurants in the neighbourhood. Especially Mama Angela's and the Steakhouse around the corner. What we didn't enjoy: - The breakfast that was more like a cake buffet without healthy alternatives. A diabetic would have problems finding something to eat without too much sugar. - The beds that were pretty hard and uncomfortable. - The hydro-massage shower that sometimes inflicted more pain than pleasure... To summarize: a good hotel for the price and Mr Franco Spaccialbelli really made our day. I guess we were extremely lucky with timing as well since we spent 14-16 Dec in Rome and there were almost no tourists anywhere. We had been warned about the long queues and therefore paid extra to pre-book tickets to the Vatican but it turned out to be completely unnecessary since there was no queue at all! We could walk right through. The same applied for Colosseum. Maybe some people who heard about the recent flooding of the Tiber canceled in the last minute. Anyway, a great trip for us!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Budget-Minded”
Reviews.Author: brokeguy
Reviews.Content: On the first night we got lost trying to find it, once we got our bearings, it was a very easy walk to the Termini. On one corner there are embassies and Armed Guards with automatic weapons all night, so walking home we felt very safe. The room was decent and heated perfectly, the mattress was a bit hard but did it's job. Alessandro was very helpful even at 4am when we woke up asking for a Internet Key :).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: HelsInTheSun
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel mid morning and was pleasantly suprised, it was located in a nice area (near Embassies) and not in any way run down. The walk from Termini station took us just over 5 mins, the pavement did not cause us any problems whatsoever and was easy to find following the directions from the hotel website. I had emailed the hotel prior to arriving with a couple of questions and they were very quick with their response, which was good... The room was ready when we checked in at 11am which was handy being there for only three full days!! The room was very clean and decorated in a beautiful way. I am fussy when it comes to the room and cleanliness and this got 10 out of 10 for it all. It was perfect for a place to sleep when visiting this beautiul city for a long weekend!! The bathroom was also very clean and they supplied you with toilettries along with fresh towels every day. The location of the hotel was great for the money that we paid for the hotel. It was a 5min walk from Termini where you can catch trains/buses/metro from to explore the whole city. We opted to buy a Hop on Hop off tourist bus ticket rather than using the normal buses as we had no idea where they went to and how to pay to use them!!! The sight seeing tour buses suited us fine and we got to see all of the sites that we set out to during the three day break. I highly reccomend that you visit the Vatican and Colusseum and that you pre book tickets beforehand to enable you to jump the queue. The queues were so long it would have put me off going to visit them, but well worth paying the little bit extra to guarantee a place there... There was a fantastic restaurant that we ate out in that was oposite the Pantheon. If you are stood with your back to the entrance, there are a number of cafe/restaurants in the square oposite. It was the second one on the left (I can't remember the name now!) and the food was out of this world! It cost 12 euros for a pizza or pasta disa, plus a wine/beer/juice and then a coffee to finish. It was the tastiest meal I had during my visit there. We also ate in Piazza Navona, and it cost us a small fortune for a very small portion! My boyfriend had to eat again 1/2 hr later!! You must throw a coin in Trevi Fountain for your return to the city and you also need to sample the Galeta ice creams that are found on many corners throughout the city, they are out of this world! Considering it was November when we visited, it was still very busy in restaurants and most of the attractions, so I would dread to think what it would be like in the height of Summer!! The weather was a bit hit and miss while we were there but it did not stop us from visiting everything we wanted to. All in all, the hotel was fantastic, very quaint but with modern features. The lift was beautiful and very quiet!! We did not hear anyone in the ajoining rooms nor did we get disturbed by anyone in the corridors. Infact it was the best sleep that the pair of us have had in a long while!! The TV had a couple of english channels on and there was a minibar in the room too. We kept a couple of bottles of drink in there that we bought from the loal supermarket and they did not seem to mind. As for the Temini area as a whole, I felt extremely safe at all times of the day and night, there is a chinese restaurant between the hotel and the station where we ate one night and the walk back at just after mid night was pleasant! I will definatley be visiting the city again in the Summer and will definatley without a doubt stay in this lovely hotel again. 10 out of 10 all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelerAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo for four nights in October, 2008. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again. This was our second visit to Rome, so we have another hotel to compare with—but there is no comparison at all. The hotel location is excellent: just about 8 blocks or ten minutes walk from Rome Termini. Don’t forget that the closest Metro Station is the Castro Praetoria station, only about 5 minutes away. The rooms were small but clean and comfortable. We especially enjoyed the shower which had excellent water pressure and plenty of hot water. Also the air conditioning in the room worked extremely well, as Rome was still enjoying rather warm weather. Tip: if you run the fan on low, you will muffle any sound from adjoining rooms. That said, the hotel was quiet and peaceful. The breakfast was a simple and tasty continental breakfast in a bright room. The coffee was outstanding. The best part of this experience was the hotel staff. They were the FRIENDLIEST, most polite, and helpful staff of any of the European hotels (including some 4 or 5 star) we have stayed at in the past 10 years! That includes everyone from the four gentlemen at the hotel desk, the housekeeper, and the breakfast room ladies. As another person mentioned, FRANCO S was just great and I especially enjoyed talking with him. We had booked an early tour to Pompeii and Franco and his colleague sprang into action and made us cappuccinos and packed croissants for us to take early one morning. Much appreciated. KARINA (sp) in the breakfast room was also wonderful: she looked after us and kept those coffee cups full of café latte and cappuccino. It is such a pleasure to see smiling, kind faces.
