If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel, clean comfortable rooms, excellent location, and the friendliest staff—this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBCCoq
Reviews.Content: We booked two standard double rooms directly with the hotel via their website for five nights from Aug. 29 to Sept. 3, 2008. The hotel more than met our expectations - bedrooms and bathrooms were a good size, spotlessly clean, nicely furnished, clean white towels daily and complimentary toiletries. Breakfast was more than adequate and plentiful - enough to see us through most of the day. Good staff at the front desk, especially Franco, who was unfailingly friendly, helpful and informative. A great three star hotel at good rates - couldn't have asked for better! By the way, visit Mamma Angela's down the street from the hotel for a fine dinner - good food at reasonable prices. The owner and staff are courteous and friendly. Rome is a walking city so be prepared for lots of walking - the only way to explore this beautiful city. The Termini station and first stop for the red "hop on and hop on" tourist bus are close by. We got a great deal on this bus at 15 euros each for 48 hours instead of 24. Gelato was a must have treat every day in such hot weather. For the best gelato, visit the "Blue Ice" cafes. Would we recommend Hotel Montecarlo to anyone and would we stay there again - you bet we would!

Reviews.Title: “Good valur for money”
Reviews.Author: wale09
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Rome for 3 nights for her birthday last December staying at the Montcarlo hotel. Arriving 10 hours late due to an airport strike that day, the friendly reception staff made us feel very welcome. First impressions of the hotel was quaint and well decorated with some authentic features (the old cast iron lift). The room was decorated in traditional Italian style and well furnished. It included ac and a TV. I found the bathroom a decent size also. Breakfast was a continetal style; an adequate selection of food. The location was very good, situated minutes walk from Termini station (Rome's main train and bus station). The area was clean and quiet for a prime city location. There are a few bars and a supermarket in close proximity with a small walk to reasonably priced restaurants. There is a sex cinema and strip club around the corner but this never caused us any offense or problems. The transport system is excellent with an underground and bus service (although Rome is a walkable city). We purchase a Roma Pass for e20 each which gave 3 days travel and free admission to 2 attractions, with discount on the rest. This can be bought from the Termini station. Locals are very helpful and will speak English if you attempt to speak a little Italian. The food is obviously exceptional being Italy and the best restaurants we found were family ran places tucked down little side streets. Rome is a beautiful place to visit; a picturesque city and this hotel was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Pailton
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about the location of this hotel as I had read that the area around Rome's Termini could be a little seedy. Having just returned from our family trip to Rome we found the area felt very safe and had no problems whatsoever. We chose this hotel as it was fairly central and also could accomodate our family in a room sleeping four rather than having to book two rooms. The hotel was very clean and, whilst the room was a little 'snug' for 4 people, it more than met our needs. The kids were particularly thrilled with the fact that Sky TV was installed in the room and UK/US TV shows could be viewed in English - not that there was much time for TV viewing as there are an abundance of sights to see. It is possible to get around Rome on foot or use public transport but for convenience we opted for a 'hop on - hop off' bus tour. A 2 day ticket on the Citysightseeingtour red bus (red line starts at Via Marsala next to termini and close to hotel) cost 44 Euros for the family of 4 which was very reasonable compared to other companies and, whilst they did not run as frequently as some of the other tour buses, we found it a very good service and felt that we saw parts of the city that we may not have seen otherwise. All in all a great stay in Rome at the Montecarlo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: Spymon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo in May and it was a great base for our stay in Rome. The hotel is just a short walk from the Termini station so is very convenient to get to if you have taken the airport train to the station. There are quite a few other hotels in this area as well, though not that many restaurants. Near to the hotel are the Turkish and British embassies so there's armed police on the corner all the time, not that we ever felt unsafe in this area. Using the bus and the metro you can get to almost anywhere in Rome pretty easily apart from Trastevere. The Roman Forum/Colosseum and Villa Borghese are walkable as well. The service was really great here from the off. The staff at the desk was friendly, helpful and comfortable at speaking a number of languages. They also helped us book tickets for the Villa Borghese; they also provided a map of the city centre and a small guide book as well. The interior of the hotel reminded me of a Parisian apartment building. Our room was small but newly furnished (bar a little wear and tear but nothing major) with plenty of storage space for 2 people as well as a flat screen TV. There was little background noise unless you had the window open. The air conditioning was cold enough to keep the room cool anyway. Probably the only complaints about the room was the size of the bathroom which was a little tight if two of you were trying to get ready and the lack of free plug sockets. The power shower was excellent after a busy day walking and there were no problems with pressure or hot water. Breakfast was also included. This was in the form of a self service buffet with toast, hot drinks (the coffee from the machine was a little disappointing compared to some of the espresso found elsewhere in Rome), fruit juice and fresh filled pastries and croissants (chocolate and custard) which were always replenished right up till the end of breakfast service. Whilst the room rate was more expensive than in many other European cities we have stayed in it appeared to be good value for the time of year compared to other places in Rome we looked at online.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: laurkat99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was AWFUL. We dropped our things off for only a second. When we arrived back from walking Rome all day, we found a distinct odor of feces and garbage from our room. We found that the carpet was soaking wet and had wondered if there was a leak that we were not infomred about. We tried sleeping and the stench was so overwhelming that we called downstairs to see if we could switch rooms. The manager was very rude and told us there we no other rooms available( which was a blatent lie because we saw 1 other couple there the whole 24 hours) and that it was a 3 star hotel so what did we expect?? I expected not to smell poop the entire night of sleep before a 9 hour plane ride. That place was disgusting and I advise all who want polite assistance for the good money you are paying to NOT go there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: smokeyjoeIreland
Reviews.Content: Following 2 trips just after xmas staying in 5 star hotels in 2 different countries, this 3 star hotel was very good step .We had a very warm reception on arrival, and normal check procedures went without issue. The double room was on the 2nd floor, and it was extremely clean with ample space. Also, the window overlooked onto the street and added to the flavor waking up in the morning looking out on Rome. The area is about a 5-7 minute walk from termini so It is well located. We got a taxi home one night from Spanish steps, and it worked out at about 8Euro. The only fault maybe I had with the stay was the fact there was no "Do Not Disturb" or "No Service" tags for the door, and felt my privacy was interrupted , but other than that it was everything a 3 star lived up to be. Worth the stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DocNottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a Superior double. Although the room was small, it was in good condition and it had a fantastic shower! As mentioned by other reviewers, the breakfast is basic, rolls, croissants, cereal and coffee from a machine. If you don't expect a massive choice you won't be disappointed. It suited us fine for what we wanted. Its about 10 mins walk from termini station where we caught the tour buses that take you round all the sites. The hotel is in the Embassy area of the city, so there are armed guards everywhere 24hrs so its very safe at night. We found a couple of good restaurants in walking distance (Steak House, I'm a vegetarian and the pasta was great) and Mamma Angelas (i think) which again served fab pasta and pizza. Overall the hotel was clean and in good condition and the staff were friendly. If you don't mind walking its location is ok, but not in the centre of things.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: Marelle
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in Rome for 4 nights at Hotel Montecarlo. The location is perfect, once you get your barings it's only a short walk to Termini where we took a bus tour of the city on our first day. It really is the best way to get a feel for the city for a first-time visitor. The area around Termini is a little dodgy..we weren't bothered by anyone but best to have your wits about you. A tip for the tour ticket would be to buy a 48 hr tkt, we went with GTM (green/grey opentop bus) which was €22, one day is €18, so you make a saving and we used it a lot during our first 2 days. After that it is easy enough to find sites by foot, the hotel gave a really good map. The hotel was v.good, v.clean and spacious, we went for the superior room, maybe I was a little naive! but the Jacuzzi i'd been looking forward to was a stand up(with a seat!) shower thats sprays massasing jets of water,i was expecting a tub but still it was good especially after all the walking we did! Brekkie was more than adequate&set us up for the day. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Isak A
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo two nights in February. Location is excellent. It is only a five minutes walk from Termini, if one reads the map in advance. I have stayed in Rome at several occacions, and the location is good. Of course this depends on what sights your going to, but Piazza Repubblica and Via Nazionale is just a five minutes walk away. From there one can easily find public transportation. Also I agreee that one should not mind the adult theater located nearby - we walked home that way both nights, and there wasn't any disturbances. The restaurants nearby are of variying quality - please beware of the "Grill" on the street in direction of Piazza Repubblica, the staff shows extremely little interest in you... The hotel itself is good standard, and clean. We booked a superior room, but I don't know if that's worth the extra. Room was of good size, and bathroom also good size and clean. Good towels and linen, but the bed might be a bit hard if one minds that. Please also keep in mind that this is in the middle of Rome - there will be street noise. The breakfast isn't bad - my girlfriend that can be a bit demanding about hotel breaksfasts was satisified. Of course one should keep in mind that this is three star hotel and adjust ones expectations accordingly. But the quality of the food served was good. (If you wan't exceptional breakfast in Rome - check Capo d'africa - an excellent hotel!) Checking in and out was quick. This is clearly a hotel catering to mostly tourists, the receptionist refused to speak italian to my girlfriend (who has lived in Rome, and speaks acceptable italian), he answered her in english. Don't expect much from the "rome city map" mentioned on the hotel site - this is a standard promotional map that you get on all Romes hotels. Had booked two rooms, but had to cancel one of the rooms the day before due to sickness. This was handled good by the hotel, charging one night according to the terms. In conclusion this is a good hotel - but nothing exceptional. But I think it deserves it's rather high ranking on Tripadvisor, especially because of the price. Will be going back if I get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: at_doha
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is close to Termini Station, only short walking distance. Hotel staff is helpful and friendly. Breakfast is not much choice. Quad room is too small for a family with 2 teenagers, not an easy movement around the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: kaz077
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montecarlo 27th Dec 2007 till 1st Jan 2008 with my husband, 11 year old daughter and parents both 67. Did a lot of research on hotels prior to booking and was very impressed with the Montecarlo. Recent previous reviews were spot on. Rooms of a high standard, very clean, decent size, and for the first time in ages, our family room had a proper bed for my daughter and enough room that we weren't tripping over each other. We paid for the superior room which had Sky TV, CD player, mini bar and jucuzzi bath. Well worth the extra couple of £'s. Breakfast was the usual continental affair, which was fine to start you off first thing. Around 9.30am the restaurant did get a little crowded and some people struggled for a table. That said there was no problem with picking up what you wanted and either taking it up to the small bar area or too your room. Franko on reception was fantanstic. Very friendly and nothing to much trouble. Didn't try the restaurant across the road, but the 2 just down the street were very reasonable and food great. Police cars on street corners due to the foreign embassies meant you felt very safe out walking at night. Given the price, the hotel location was great. 10 mins from Termini and 20 min walk to centre. Thoughly recommend this hotel. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shadow168
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel that was within walking distance from Termini. It was in a safe neighborhood. There was a police car stationed one block away because of an embassy. The hotel staff spoke English and was pleasant. There was a continental breakfast which consisted of pastries, yogurt, cake, bread, cereal, juice and coffee. The hotel room was very clean and quiet. The shower was small, but not much different than other showers we experenced in other hotels in Italy. We got a good deal, 80 euro, per night. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only downside is that a lot of tourists stay in that area so the restaurants around the hotel are touristy. Luckily we mastered the bus system so it was easy to go somewhere else to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A really excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm-Sparkes
Reviews.Content: We, my wife two daughters 22 & 18 and myself stopped at the Monte Carlo from the 2 to 6 January 2008. Gathered info via Travel Advisor and certainly made the right decision. Booked direct with hotel, arranged transfers from the airport. Staff were marvalous and could not do enough for us. Superior class rooms were spacious and included a shower with jaccussi and turkish bath, good heating system, fridge bar and yes SKY tv in English. Breakfast was a wonderful collection of different rolls, danish pastries etc plus serials, cheese etc. Late bar meant you could have a last relaxing drink after a hectic tour before bed. Lots of nearby restaurants and one gives 10% off the total cost of the meal. Hotel is close to all the tourist areas and the metro. We used the metro but found that for four a taxi was very good value eg 10 euro to the vatican. All in all a great holiday at a great hotel in a great city, cannot wait to return. Malcolm Sparkes

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: KKOJHA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Montecarlo with my wife from 15th to 17 Nov.2007. Had booked a Limo thro Romeshuttle which dropped us at the gate of another hotel and left.It was raining heavily and we were stranded there for more than an hour.I brought a taxi and we reached the Hotel.Front Staff was very helpful and hearing the problem we faced upgraded our room,helped us in luggage shifting.Other front office staff was also very helpful and guided us nicely.Room was clean with simple decoration.Bathroom was clean with required toiletries. Breakfast was OK for Vegetarians like us.I will recommend the Hotel to my friends and would love to stay here again. K.K.OJHA,India.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: David_Susie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and had a very pleasant stay. The staff were accommodating and friendly. The room was large enough, exceptionally clean and the bathroom very well appointed (extremely complex shower/jacuzzi setup - but fun trying to work it out). The room had a great ceiling (you'll see if you go there) but it had a very small but elegant lift (but grateful for any lift after carting luggage around). Breakfast was simple but enjoyable. Location was convenient to the Termini (hint - catch the public buses - they are cheap and go everywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and a great value”
Reviews.Author: lioncloud
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely place to stay. It was clean, well furnished, and the staff were helpful. The elevator alone (see some of the the photos others have left) was a favorite aspect for all of us. Yes, there is an adult cinema down the street, but there are also numerous restaurants, grocery-store-type establishments, and gelaterias. Do NOT eat at the restaurant directly across the street. It is extremely expensive and the food is awful. It is indeed a convenient walk to the Termini station, but a rather more lengthy walk to the Trevi Fountain. I would like to try out a hotel a bit more centrally located for comparison, but would stay here again without a qualm.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: RoyIpswich
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms, friendly staff, breakfast not too grand. Altogether good experience.

Reviews.Title: “small and clean hotel, not much to say about it.”
Reviews.Author: Lean_10
Reviews.Content: not much to say, average hotel. small rooms, clean bathrooms. the neighboorhood is fine we walk in and out at any time and we didnt have any problem. the breakfast is horrible but I really dont care.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, Awful Breakfast, Friendly(?) Staff”
Reviews.Author: elenitsaCyprus
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 30 of August, after an exhausting flight from Cyprus to Rome. We thought to take the Leonardo Da Vinci express train to Termini station, and this was the biggest mistake. Everyone scared us that the taxis are expensive etc, and we took the train. There was no air conditioning, and the hotel was 800 meters away from the Termini station. We walked the distance... but we were literally exhausted by the time we got to the hotel. The staff was quite friendly,and led us to the elevator. We expected that the room was going to be a little bigger... instead, it was tiny. The tv was tiny too. The view from the window, was the roof of another building. But , we did not complaint. After all, we chose that hotel. Everything was closed at three, including restaurants and pizzerias. We were hungry, but we had nothing to eat, but chocolates. The breakfast at the hotel was poor, a coffee machine and a lot of breads with butter and marmalades to eat with. 3 juice types were also available, and cornflakes as well. We expected english breakfast... But we did not complaint about that neither. The only thing that made us complaint, was the noise next to our room, every morning. There were bulding works, and it was a terrible noise. My husband made a complaint to the hotel, but the only thing they had to say was:' I can't do anything, it is Sunday tomorrow, so they will stop. ' So, they did not help us with that. Monday morning, while we were sleeping, the door of our room opened and a housekeeper left a bottle of water on the floor and left again! I didn't notice what had happened, because I was sleeping, but my husband, who saw the whole thing, called the housekeeper, but she didn't give any attention. She got in, and left as if it was her own room. I was very angry. But hey... we were just tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money peaceful and safe.”
Reviews.Author: Sarge42
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at this hotel. Booked it direct on the website had a great offer and it was certainly value for the money. Rooms were more than adequate, recently refurbished and it showed. Sound proofed and quiet. Air conditioning a bonus and a must for this time of year. Spotlessly clean bathroom but one word of caution, rooms without a bath have very small shower cubicles. I am 6 ft and 17 stone any larger and you'll not get into the gap for the shower cubicle, or even worst not get out, I had to lever myself in and out. A small minus for an otherwise good hotel. Staff friendly and knowledgeable re transport etc. Location on opposite side of city to most of the Iconic Sites but only 2 minute walk to metro and buses. Then only ten minutes to sites etc. Rome public transport is very good and cheap. If staying for more than a couple of days buy a week's ticket for 16 Euros a great saving. Hotel is located adjacent to the British, Russian and other Embassies so it is the safest place to walk back to from the transport there are 24/7 armed police on the street corners. Breakfast is the normal European breakfast not a great choice but plenty of what was available. Cereals bread cheese yoghurts cakes etc. As for Rome itself I went for the Iconic and Historical sites which were a must and fanastic. Pre booked tours with Icon of Rome tours a little above the average but what great value. No queueing at Vatican and the Clossium. Very knowledgeable guides. At the Vatican tour there was six of us and only two couples for the Historic tour.I have travelled many Cities,Rome is certainly not amongst my favourites, very dirty everywhere seems to have a layer of soot whatever you touch leaves a black mark on your clothes. The metro is exceptionally dirty do not touch any wall or poster and there are thieves about they roam in groups they have the appearance of Romany Gypsys, they are small in stature and one woman will be carrying a baby to distract you . No violence but they are about so watch your bag like a hawk. Romans must be amongst the most rude, surly and ignorant of people. Food was also a disappointment. Visit the Main Piazzas for the atmostphere but eat and drink near the Hotel, it's cheap and far superior food. All this said please visit, the sites are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Daveesl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MonteCarlo from Dec 24 until Dec 28th. We got a fantastic deal on it from Hotels.com, paying less than $100 per night, which is far below its least advertised price. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. I can't say enough good things about them. Our room was on the 4th floor, accessed by way of a very small but fun elevator. The room was small, but fine for the 2 of us. The room was always clean and felt very secure. The hotel provides FREE high speed internet access in the rooms. Bring a Cat-5 cable if you decide to use it. There is also a paid internet point near the lobby. We never tried the breakfast, but it looked like packaged bake goods. However, just around the corner, across from the adult theater is a fantastic little pizza joint that is fun, has good local food and is very cheap. Ok, the area, you saw the thing on the adult theater. Yes it is around the corner, but it isn't like some place crawling with pervs. You ignore it. Down this same street are a couple of laundramats within about 5 blocks of the hotel and some little shops. To the opposite, there are 2 embassies within a couple of blocks of the hotel, so there is 24 hour security at both ends of the street. While the side streets aren't the prettiest, they aren't that bad either. The hotel is actually about 600 meters from Termini and 300 meters from the Castro Pretorio metro line. We found it really convenient and safe. We were out at all times of the day and night and never felt threatened. We are in our mid-50s. We would definately stay there again. dave

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcgolfer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nghts at the hotel and absolutely loved it. Ivano at the front desk was sooooo helpful with directions and other questions we had. My wife used a wheelchair and the hotel stored it for us. The breakfast was very acceptable and on the last day we had an early flight so they fixed us a breakfast to take with us. Unheard of! Very close to all attractions and never a fear walking the streets. We just made reservations to come back to Rome next May and we will be contacting the Montecarlo to see if they can accomodate us.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shewell
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel recently and thought it was very nice. We had a superior room which was large with a big bathroom and a plasma TV. The room was nicely furnished and clean with a fancy Turkish bath shower that we couldn't figure out how to work! I cannot stress enough how friendly and helpful the staff were on reception. They were polite and welcoming and one allowed us to use the reception computer to check-in for our flights online - despite it being 10:30pm. My only criticism would be of the breakfast which is uninspiring. There is all the usual juices, coffee, tea etc plus some cereal (could have been pieces of cardboard - it was hard to tell) and pastries. It's fine to fill you up before a day of sightseeing but if you're there for more than a few days I'd look elsewhere for breakfast. The hotel is on the edge of the central, main part of Rome but is near to the metro line stations of Termini and Castro Pretoria so is well located to visit the Vatican, Collosseum, Trevi fountain etc. Anywhere else, however, is a bit of a walk. There are a couple of nice restaurants near by, one in particular is just round the corner and does excellent pizza for not very much money. the further into the centre of Rome you get the more expensive it is but the food isn't necessarily any better. Overall this is a very nice hotel with lovely friendly staff. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the railway station, so you can go walking (about 5-10 min.) and you also have subway in the area, so the location is good, even though its not in the most glamourous part of the city. The room we got was really small, with an even smaller bathroom, but everything worked ok, we had no problems. The breakfast is poor, you only have one kind of bread and so on... The hotel is in a building where also live other people, as i think its common in italy. The hotel is ok, i would recomend it for its location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cool oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Junius
Reviews.Content: Ten minutes walk from the hurly-burly of Rome Termini station is this quiet and comfortable place in the diplomatic district (Russian, Turkish and British embassies all very close by). We could not fault the room or the facilities (jacuzzi in 'superior' rooms) and the aircon was effective but quiet (and necessary, as 37C outside throughout our stay) so a great place to siesta in the heat of the day. Reception friendly and efficient, the lift was period but worked, the breakfast not elaborate but efficiently run and entirely adequate. There's a supermarket five minutes away between Termini and the hotel, and a host of reasonable trattoria/pizzeria in the streets around the hotel - we never spent more than 20 euros a head with wine. A great find - thanks to the previous reviews on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at the Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: Salute07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early June 1st through 4th. Service was outstanding. They were very friendly and assisted with all of our questions. Language was no barrier. We were traveling with young children and they were very accomodating to our various requests from directions to needing more towels. Franco at the front desk was exceptional. The hotel was very nice, with a cozy feel to it. The decorative elevator was a nice feature. The room and bathroom were both very clean. Location is definitely convenient to the Termini, a 10 minute walk with children. We also walked to the Trevi Fountain (20 min) and the Gallery Borghese (10). We found a Bar on the street behind the hotel that allowed quick snacks and gelato and a decent pizzeria around the corner. We definitely would stay again and would also recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid performance – Deserves your consideration if you want to be near Termini”
Reviews.Author: coverpoint
Reviews.Content: Our favourite hotel near Termini was booked for the one night stay we needed in Rome, so it was on to Trip Advisor to look for a Plan B. We looked for a highly rated hotel at less than 150 Euros for the night – unfortunately, this appears to be an impossible task, so we were happy when the Hotel Montecarlo delivered a solid 3 star experience for our 174 Euros. We had a clean, comfortable "superior" room overlooking via Palestro. The large double bed and spare single bed allowed room to spread out. The breakfast was agreeable, with a choice of cereals, pastries, yoghurt etc. Quite sufficient to start the day. In short, this hotel is worthy of your consideration if you would like to stay close to Roma Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Plutonic
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of the many good reviews, and were not disappointed - the staff were friendly and obliging, the room was well appointed and comfortable, the public areas were very nicely decorated and we found the breakfasts perfectly adequate. Since the hotel is only a few minutes' walk from the station, we were slightly worried after having booked to read in several Rome guides that "the area around Termini station is not very pleasant" - but, whilst it may not be the most beautiful part of Rome, the area is not run-down and we felt very safe walking there, even at night. The hotel's location was ideal for train and bus travel, and we also walked to many of Rome's major attractions from the hotel. The only negative I can think of is that the towel rail had a habit of falling off the wall, but otherwise the bathroom was excellent. Also there was no safe in the room - but we kept our documents and spare money in the hotel's safe - access to this was no problem, as the reception desk is manned 24 hours a day. Remember to pack a travel kettle if you like an early morning cuppa. We kept milk in the mini-fridge - there was an instruction not to keep your own items in the fridge, but we ignored this and no-one ever said anything. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to relax in pleasant, friendly surroundings without having to pay over-the-top prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Jill0400
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to the proximity of the train station. It was perfect for walking, only a couple of blocks. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and most importantly, the bathroom was exceptional. The neighborhood felt safe with many restaurants to eat at. It was perfect for the price and the location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pantera12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo the last three nights of our stay in Rome. The lobby was small but functional but the guest rooms were beautiful. We had a fully opening window that looked onto a courtyard of Roman apartments where we could see people tending their gardens. Flat screen TV (which we never used) and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aj79
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Close to the central Train/bus depot. ( 5 minute walk). Good restaurant in the street behind the hotel. Loved 3 day stay. Look at the weather forcast and remember to take umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3* hotel, excellent location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: MrWhyte
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, with a few minor improvement this hotel has the potential to be described as excellent. Room & Staff: Spacious room, helpful staff (returned clean towels in a matter of minutes when we realised they were missing from the bathroom), wonderful jacuzzi. Hotel location: Not the best views but very convenient as it is within walking distance to Station Termini which is the main overhead, metro and bus station, which all trains stop at. Especially ideal if you plan to travel to other parts of Italy as you can catch a train to anywhere else in the country from Termini Breakfast: Adequate, basic, juice, tea making facilities, not the best croissants or tastiest orange juice. Improvements: Shower was taped to bathroom wall as it was a bit loose Breakfast could be a little better TV reception kept cutting out on sky news, but CNN was fine Despite these minor improvement I have suggested and trust me they are minor, I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “9 nights in November”
Reviews.Author: porkister
Reviews.Content: The good the bad and the mixed: * within walking distance of the main objectives (I can speak only for myself; my mom probably would consider Vatican too far to walk to); close to Metro; 10 mins walk from Termini (15-20 mins if you include the long walk to/from track 29) * price was OK, booked via hotel's website, they accepted Amex which is a plus; with > 7 nights we got one free, so the average was ~ 100$/night at a rate of 1euro=1.3$; does not seem like a great bargain, but that's what prices in Rome are. * clean; really clean (if my wife was happy with it...!) - especially the bathroom which was relatively big compared to the tiny room; would have been happier to have clean sheets more often than once a week. the bathroom could use some hooks on the door * there was no safe in our room, but they had one under the front desk; no problems though and we happily used the provided envelope as ATM. * don't expect too much from breakfast: there is minimal to no variation; cafe/cappuccino comes from a machine and tastes like soluble coffee (maybe I am just too picky); no ham, no cheese; the little buns were delicious though - sometimes; and there is plenty of food if you don't mind croissants and canned pineapple. * the staff is pleasant and friendly with the exception of one guy at the front desk who had no clue when it came to giving directions. We just wanted to know approximately how long it would take to get to Vatican by Metro. He just shrugged his shoulders, suggested that he never takes the subway, directed us to a wrong Metro stop and made some not-so-funny jokes. * noise sometimes early in the morning (could not spot the origin) but most likely the water pipes. too tired to care about it; we slept like logs and needed wake up calls. * only one night stand and light for a double room (note that the walls are covered in dark blue wallpaper); the second light was reaaaaly weak, poorly located (over the bathroom door) and was fixed 24h after our arrival by special request. * charged 5 euros for using the minibar when in fact we did not touch anything in it. I was too tired to fight over a small sum. OVERALL I don't regret the choice for this time, since we used the hotel only for sleeping and taking a shower and after all, it offers enough for 3 stars, but I would try a different place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDay365
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 6 nights at the Montecarlo Hotel, it's a lovely hotel and well worth the money. We would stay there again if went back to Rome. Remember it is 3* so don't expect more and you will be pleasantly surprised. The Hotel is kept very clean and tidy, the staff are very nice and extremely polite. The lift is great fun! We had a superior room which was a good size and it had a lovely shower room. The bed was 2 singles joined together but it was very comfortable. The breakfast was fine, everything was fresh and kept stocked up throughout the morning - there is a selection of 3 cereals, croissants, jams, rolls and crispbreads. The coffee machine has a good selection and you can help yourself as many times as you want. There are some good restaurants near the Hotel for lunch/dinner. There is an adult cinema and sexy disco around the corner but they are very discreet and not a problem. There is an Embassy just down the road so there is always a police man on duty but we had no problems and always felt safe. We walked everywhere from the Hotel but it was quite tiring. We used the free street map they gave us to get about, it was invaluable, however be very carefull of the direction you are going in and check the road names as you go along, it is quite easy to get lost! If you don't want to walk everywhere there is plenty of public transport nearby. Rome is a great City and the sights are fantastic, so have fun and enjoy yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LesSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay - we were dissappointed we only got to stay one night. The staff was very helpful and the bar in the lobby was cozy and friendly. The location was great and safe - lots of eateries with sidewalk seating. There is also internet access which was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tahoesun1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monecarlo Sep 24th-28th. Our room was roomy and so was the bathroom. We ( a family of four) had plenty of room. Staff spoke english and the breakfast was the best we had in Italy. Close to the train station, about a 7minute walk. From there we caught the underground train everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smoothstylez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the nicest in the world but the experience is great. A great restaurant is located across the street but pricey. Internet and laundry is located down the street. The bus which takes you everywhere is a short walk away. The man at the front desk is very helpful and they were bang on when asked any questions. Buffet breakfast, well don't count on it as there is nothing really there but some old coffee with some dried up croissants. The hotel lies on a street that is well protected by guards 24hours a day and lots of tourists so you should feel very safe to walk around. The price is not cheap to stay here but compared to other places its a fair price for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing and scabby”
Reviews.Author: jess494
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Montecarlo for 5 days and were very disappointed. We found that the area was dirty and unpleasant with sex shops and strip clubs below our window. During the time of staying in the hotel the staff were not very friendly and were not given anymore soap or bathsalts, not to mention there was no shampoo or conditioner included. We were planning to go on the computer facilities available when we changed our mind after being told that we had to get our passports photocopied and write our name, how long we would be on the computer for in a book as well as with the cost of ten minutes being 6 euros. If that was not bad enough we were told that the book in which we wrote in was checked by the police every three months. We thought breakfast was very scabby, constantly running out of everything, so that at one point we went with out a croissant as there were only two or three left, so we thought it was not fair to leave all the customers for the next hour or two without the option. We found this hotel very dissapointing and we would definately not come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews for Hotel Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: kaydds
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo and were disappointed with the aloofness of the staff(except Franco). We did not feel that they made an effort to be friendly and welcoming. I was disappointed because I had read so many good things about the hotel. Our room was clean but our towels had torn edges(more than one day). The breakfast offered was fine and the location was finebut we would not stay here again. One more thing...the fruit basket is not worth the extra money.
